timelineManager.model

Class ApplicationDB

  • java.lang.Object
    • timelineManager.model.ApplicationDB

  • public class ApplicationDB
extends java.lang.Object
    This class has been designed for the project course in computer science at the Linnaeus University year 2017. This class represents the connection between the program and the database located into main root of application. Using JDBC or Java Database Connectivity is necessary. Note: This Database class, tables and it's controllers made for a specific goals, because of that tables and other prerequisite data can be seen in this class. If the user needs to use the database for other purposes rather than the current tables and columns, I strongly suggest a new design.

      • ApplicationDB

    • Method Detail

      • connectToDatabase

        public void connectToDatabase()
                       throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                              java.sql.SQLException
        This void method use JDBC(Java Database Connectivity) to create a connection with the database. By using this method if there will be no DB file,a new connection to database contains of two tables will be made. If there is a connection, the DB file or tables will not be replaced.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - SQL query is not correct or the JDBC class can not be found
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - JDBC class not exist

      • deleteAllTaskByID

        public void deleteAllTaskByID(int id)
        Find Timeline tasks and delete them by Timeline id. deleteAllTaskByID(); will delete all tasks WHERE Tasks id refer to it's own Timeline id.
        Parameters:
        id - Specified Timeline id number to delete the tasks with the same id.

      • deleteTaskByTaskID

        public void deleteTaskByTaskID(int id)
        Find tasks and delete it by it's unique id. deleteTaskByTaskID(); will delete the unique task WHERE Task id==id.
        Parameters:
        id - Specified Task unique id number to delete the task with the id.

      • deleteTimeLineByID

        public void deleteTimeLineByID(int id)
        Find Timelines and delete it by it's unique id. By deleting a Timeline data(row) the tasks that belong to that Timeline will also be gone. deleteTimeLineByID(int id); will delete the unique Timeline WHERE Timeline id is equal to id parameter.
        Parameters:
        id - Specified Timeline unique id.

      • addTask

        public void addTask(int UniqueName,
                    java.lang.String Title,
                    java.lang.String TaskDescription,
                    java.lang.String TaskStartDate,
                    java.lang.String TaskEndDate,
                    int TimelineID)
             throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                    java.sql.SQLException
        Adding data(Task) as a row to the database into TasksTable.
        Parameters:
        UniqueName - used to assign a unique number for the task.
        Title - used to assign a title for the task.
        TaskDescription - used to assign a related description for the task.
        TaskStartDate - used to assign the start date of the task.
        TaskEndDate - used to assign the end date of the task.
        TimelineID - id number of the Timeline that this task should belongs to.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - SQL query is not correct or the JDBC class can not be found
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - JDBC class not exist

      • addTimeLine

        public void addTimeLine(int TimeLineID,
                        java.lang.String TimeLineTitle,
                        java.lang.String TimelineDescription,
                        java.lang.String TimelineStartDate,
                        java.lang.String TimeLineEndDate)
                 throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                        java.sql.SQLException
        Adding data(Timeline) as a row to the database and table TimeLinesTable. All the parameters in this method will be used with an index number for the database tables columns. This method will create a row into the TimeLinesTable table. Each row has different columns to categorize the details of the Timeline. Values of the rows(?), TimeLinesTable needs 6 values to be full filled. If the connection is not null, a new PreparedStatement will be created with SQL commands. All the values will be assigned into the specified index number and the PreparedStatement will be executed and the last.
        Parameters:
        TimeLineID - id number of the Timeline.
        TimeLineTitle - used to assign a title for the Timeline.
        TimelineDescription - used to assign a related description for the Timeline.
        TimelineStartDate - used to assign the start date of the Timeline.
        TimeLineEndDate - used to assign the end date of the Timeline.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - SQL query is not correct or the JDBC class can not be found
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - JDBC class not exist

      • displaySetOfAllTasks

        public java.sql.ResultSet displaySetOfAllTasks()
                                        throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                               java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Create a SQL statement and execute the query as a ResultSet from the TasksTable. If the connection is equal to null a new connection will be created into database and tables. SQL Query description in this method: SELECT: Find the data. *: Means all the data. from: From target table. It is possible to change the method to SELECT a specified column name in the table.
        Returns:
        A set of all values based on the column names by SELECT TaskUniqueID, TTitle, TaskDesc, TaskStart, TaskEnd, TimeLineID from TasksTable
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - SQL query is not correct or the JDBC class can not be found
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - JDBC class not exist

      • displaySetOfAllTimeLines

        public java.sql.ResultSet displaySetOfAllTimeLines()
                                            throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                   java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Create a SQL statement and execute the query as a ResultSet from the TimeLinesTable. If the connection is equal to null a new connection will be created into database and tables. SQL Query description in this method: SELECT: Find the data. *: Means all the data. from: From target table. It is possible to change the method to SELECT a specified column name in the table.
        Returns:
        A set of all values based on the column names by SELECT TimeLineID, TimeLineTitle, TimeLineDesc, TimeLineStart, TimeLineEnd from TimeLinesTable.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - SQL query is not correct or the JDBC class can not be found
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - JDBC class not exist

      • printAllTasks

        public void printAllTasks()
        Print all the tasks by creating ResultSet. ResultSet might return incomparable column name if the tables are designed with different column names. while the ResultSet.next()!=false , ResultSet.getString("column name") will return the value of that column based on the current .next() pointer.

      • printAllTimelines

        public void printAllTimelines()
        Print all the Timelines by iterating through the database Timeline table.

      • getAllTaskofTheTimeline

        public java.sql.ResultSet getAllTaskofTheTimeline(long id)
                                           throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                  java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Return all the Tasks that belongs to a Timeline by long id number.
        Parameters:
        id - The id number of the Timeline
        Returns:
        ResultSet A set of all data in the TaskTable by executing a SQL query
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - SQL query is not correct or the JDBC class can not be found
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - JDBC class not exist

      • getConnection

        public java.sql.Connection getConnection()
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns:
        Connection if not null.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Statement query should be correct at the time of executing and connection variable should be implemented correctly.
        java.lang.Exception - There is no connection to get
